SUMMARY: SugaR transport-related Regulator SgrR is negatively autoregulated and coordinately activates transcription of divergent operon. This regulator coordinates response to glucose-phosphate stress [17209026, 15522088, 17383224]. As intracellular accumulation of glucose-6-phosphate correlates with SgrR induction, it has been proposed as its inducer [17209026, 15522088, 17383224]. Autoregulation of SgrR is not affected by phosphosugar stress [17209026]. In addition, induction of sgrS expression by nonmetabolizable glucose PTS substrate (+/-)-methyl glucoside is abolished in a sgrR mutant [15522088]. SgrR protein is a member of a novel family of regulators and contains an N terminal which is characteristic of winged-helix DNA-binding transcriptional regulators and a predicted C-terminal solute-binding domain [17209026].
